Row.Text: The discovery of a natural wonder gives Scouts bonus experience. Natural wonders also give an adjacency bonus to Holy Site districts. All adjacent tiles receive +2 Appeal.
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Science] Science.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears with Cliffs adjacent to water and provides +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
One tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +4 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Science] Science, and Fresh Water.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and Fresh Water. Units heal completely if they heal for one turn adjacent to the Dead Sea.

Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles. Missionaries, Inquisitors, and Apostles who move next to Mount Everest ignore Hills for the rest of the game.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It appears on coastal terrain and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles.
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Doubles the terrain yields of all adjacent tiles.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
